pullRequest.title: Show a tooltip on not yet researched hut blocks
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes proposed in this pull request:

Add a tooltip to the huts that need researching, and aren't researched yet in the colony the player last visited.

Review please

commit.message: Show a chat message when crafting a not yet researched hut block

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              "com.minecolonies.coremod.research.crafted": "You just crafted the %s, to build it you need research it at the university first.",
          
          
            
              "com.minecolonies.coremod.research.crafted": "You just crafted the %s. To build it, you must first complete its research at the University.",
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1386,6 +1386,7 @@
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.research.requirementnotmet": "Minimum research requirement not met!",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.research.started": "Research successfully started!",
   "com.minecolonies.coremod.research.havetounlock": "Build a University and research this hut to unlock it!",
+  "com.minecolonies.coremod.research.crafted": "You just crafted the %s, to build it you need research it at the university first.",

commit.message:
Update src/main/resources/assets/minecolonies/lang/en_us.json

change chat message

Co-authored-by: ravenbuilder934 <sabrinajamie@outlook.com>
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message

Replace chat message with a tooltip

The way it checks all items isn't finished yet, its just this way to
test everything else, cause i can't seem to find a good way to do that.
Fix abstractBlockHut formatting

Move some item code to the block

to remove the need for the item list.
Also add tooltips to some blocks i missed.

nodes.bodyText: this will be done on each chunk a player enters, might be a bit too much?

commit.message:
Implement feedback

 * Fix AbstractBlockHut formatting
 * Add checkResearch(Colony, String) utility method
 * Move research rechecking in BuildingUniversity into the finished if
Add research name constants to the ResearchInitializer

nodes.bodyText:
Remember that the Block classes are merely definitions, so this is defining whether research is needed for every AbstractHutBlock blockstate, everywhere, in every world.
This information must be stored per ItemStack in NBT. Then the check needs to search through all ItemStacks in the relevant player'/s inventory for a relevant Hut and update the stack NBT.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -72,6 +78,11 @@
      */
     private static final VoxelShape SHAPE = VoxelShapes.create(0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9, 0.9);
 
+    /**
+     * Whether this hut is yet to be researched in the current colony.
+     */
+    protected boolean needsResearch = false;

nodes.bodyText: You need to check this from the stack's NBT here, as it is the only thing that is actually representing the item "instance" the player is working with.

commit.message: Make the tooltip work on dedicated servers
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message
Reset research messages on world unloading

Check whether the player is actually inside the colony

before checking the tooltips

Add @OnlyIn(Dist.CLIENT) to all the client side only methods.

adding it to the needsResearch field would cause the server to crash.
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message

nodes.bodyText: This is introducing a circular dependency. Maybe some of the research stuff can be boosted into the API?

commit.message: Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/research_crafting_message
Move ItemBlockHut to api
Add ItemBlockHut constructor javadoc

Change AbstractBlockHut UnlockBuildingResearchEffect references

to AbstractResearchEffect.
Also change checkResearch IColony parameter to a IColonyView parameter

nodes.bodyText:
This is all looking good. My final nitpick, more of an opinion:
Seeing as the building name is right above this message in the tool-tip, it doesn't need to be included again. Also I think we can get it on one line. My suggestion is "Requires research at the University for hut construction"
EDIT: depending on how long that is in monospace it might still be better on two lines. shrugs however you think.
